page.title: 03Landscore Primary School
page.content: Landscore Primary School (first phase) was built in 1975. It is a semi{open-plan}school - its four main "classrooms" leading onto a corridor. The second phase of the school has not been built, so two{mobiles}have been added to the main site and the infant pupils remain at the{Old School,}300 metres away. There are just under 180 pupils, aged 5-11, with 5.5 teaching staff and the Headmistress, Mrs Postance. The school's{name}is{derived}from the farm land that was "scored" off or divided into strips according to ownership. One of the children describes Landscore thus: "The children that go to Landscore are usually quite{well-mannered.}Some children in some schools are much ruder."
